byline.original: By JACK EWING AND STEPHEN CASTLE

snippet: France wants to dip into the European bailout fund to replenish its banks’ capital stock; Germany says no. The dispute between two biggest guarantors of the fund clouds any end to the debt crisis.
lead_paragraph: France wants to dip into the European bailout fund to replenish its banks’ capital stock; Germany says no. The dispute between two biggest guarantors of the fund clouds any end to the debt crisis.

headline.main: Europe Seems to Agree on Recapitalizing Banks — but How?
headline.print_headline: In France and Germany, Divergence On How to Recapitalize Their Banks
headline.seo: In France and Germany, Divergence on How to Recapitalize Banks
